Algorithm.title: What is Counting Sort?
Algorithm.description: Counting sort is an algorithm for sorting a collection of objects according to keys that are small integers.

Algorithm.title: 계수 정렬(Counting Sort)이란
Algorithm.description: 오브젝트의 키(key), 인덱스, 등 숫자를 가지고 정렬하는 알고리즘.

Algorithm.title: What is Quick Sort?
Algorithm.description: Quick sort is an efficient sorting algorithm that can be faster than the merge or heap sort - if implemented correctly.

Algorithm.title: 퀵 정렬(Quick Sort)이란
Algorithm.description: 구현 방식에 따라 병할정렬과 힙정렬보다 빠른 효율적인 정렬 알고리즘.

Algorithm.title: What is Bubble Sort?
Algorithm.description: Bubble sort is the simplest sorting algorithm which works by repeatedly comparing and swapping two adjacent elements if they're in the wrong order.

Algorithm.title: バブルソート「Bubble Sort」とは
Algorithm.description: 隣接する2個の要素を反復的に比較して、位置を変えながら整列が行われるアルゴリズム。

Algorithm.title: 거품 정렬(Bubble Sort)이란
Algorithm.description: 인접한 두 요소를 비교하고 순서가 틀릴 시 서로 위치를 바꾸는 과정을 반복하며 정렬을 하는 알고리즘.

Algorithm.title: What is Merge Sort?
Algorithm.description: Merge sort is an efficient comparison-based, divide-and-conquer algorithm invented by John von Neumann in 1945.

Algorithm.title: マージソート「Merge Sort」とは
Algorithm.description: 分割統治「Divide-and-Conquer」アルゴリズムと呼ばれる効率的なアルゴリズム。

Algorithm.title: 병합 정렬(Merge Sort)이란
Algorithm.description: 존 폰 노이만(John von Neumann)이 고안한 분할정복(divide-and-conquer) 방식의 효율적인 정렬 알고리즘.

Algorithm.title: What is Selection Sort?
Algorithm.description: Selection sort is an in-place comparison sorting algorithm. Generally it performs worse than the insertion sort on larger lists.

Algorithm.title: 選択ソート「Selection Sort」とは
Algorithm.description: In-placeアルゴリズムの一つ。一般的に挿入ソートよりファフォマンスが悪い。

Algorithm.title: 선택 정렬(Selection Sort)이란
Algorithm.description: 제자리 정렬 알고리즘 중 하나. 일반적으로 삽입 정렬보다 느린 정렬 속도를 가진다.

Algorithm.title: What is Insertion Sort?
Algorithm.description: Insertion sort is an efficient sorting algorithm for sorting smaller sets of data.

Algorithm.title: 挿入ソート「Insertion Sort」とは
Algorithm.description: 少ない数のデータを整列するとき効率的なアルゴリズム。

Algorithm.title: 삽입 정렬(Insertion Sort)이란
Algorithm.description: 적은 수의 자료들을 정렬할 때 효율적인 절령 알고리즘.

Algorithm.title: Graph - Breadth First Search (BFS)
Algorithm.description: BFS starts at the root (given) node and explores all of the neighbor nodes at the present depth prior to moving on to the nodes at the next depth level.

Algorithm.title: グラフ・幅優先探索（BFS）
Algorithm.description: 近隣のノードたちから探索するアルゴリズム。

Algorithm.title: 그래프 - 넓이 우선 탐색 (BFS)
Algorithm.description: 루트 노드에서 시작해 인접한 노드들을 먼저 탐색하는 알고리즘.

Algorithm.title: Graph - Depth First Search (DFS)
Algorithm.description: DFS starts at the root (given) node and explores as deep as possible along each branch before backtracking.

Algorithm.title: グラフ・深さ優先探索（DFS）
Algorithm.description: rootノードから始めてもう走査ができないノードまで深く探索するアルゴリズム。

Algorithm.title: 그래프 - 깊이 우선 탐색 (DFS)
Algorithm.description: 루트 노드에서 시작해 다음 분기로 넘어가기 전, 해당 분기를 끝까지 탐색하는 알고리즘.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・Queue
DataStructure.description: Queue is a linear data structure which follows a particular order in which the operations are performed -- FIFO.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・큐(queue)란
DataStructure.description: First-In-First-Out (FIFO)구조로 자료를 저장하는 형식의 선형 자료구조.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・Stack
DataStructure.description: Stack is a linear data structure which follows a particular order in which the operations are performed -- LIFO or FILO.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・스택(stack)이란
DataStructure.description: Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) 또는 First-In-Last-Out (FILO) 구조로 자료를 저장하는 선형 자료구조.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・Array
DataStructure.description: Array is a data structure consisting of a collection of elements, each identified by at least one array index or key.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・配列「array」とは
DataStructure.description: 同じデータ型の変数を含むコンテナ。

DataStructure.title: Ruby・배열(array)이란
DataStructure.description: 같은 타입형의 변수들로 이루어진 유한 집합. 각각의 요소들은 메모리 상에 연속적으로 나열되어 있다.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・Circular Linked List
DataStructure.description: Circular linked list is a variation of a linked list where the first node points to the last node and vice versa.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・循環リスト「Circular Linked List」とは
DataStructure.description: 最初と最後のノードがつながってる連結リスト。

DataStructure.title: Ruby・원형 연결 리스트(Circular Linked List)란
DataStructure.description: 첫 번째와 마지막 노드가 서로 연결되어 있는 리스트.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・Doubly Linked List
DataStructure.description: Doubly linked list is a bidirectional linked list, that is, it can be traversed in either direction.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・双方向リスト「Doubly Linked List」とは
DataStructure.description: 双方向のポインタを持ってるノードからなるリスト。

DataStructure.title: Ruby・이중 연결 리스트(Doubly Linked List)란
DataStructure.description: 양방향의 포인터를 가진 노드로 이루어진 리스트.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・Singly Linked List
DataStructure.description: Singly linked list is a unidirectional linked list, that is, it can only traverse in forward direction.

DataStructure.title: Ruby・単方向リスト「Singly Linked List」とは
DataStructure.description: 単方向のポインタを持ってるノードからなるリスト。

DataStructure.title: Ruby・단일 연결 리스트(Singly Linked List)란
DataStructure.description: 단일 방향의 포인터를 가진 노드로 이루어진 리스트.

DataStructure.title: What is Linked List?
DataStructure.description: A linked list is a linear collection of data elements whose order is not given by their physical placement in memory.

DataStructure.title: 連結リスト「Linked List」とは
DataStructure.description: メモリに離れているデータ「node」たちを連結しながらデータを保存するデータ構造。

DataStructure.title: 연결 리스트(Linked List)란
DataStructure.description: 데이터와 포인터를 가지는 노드를 한 줄로 연결해서 데이터를 저장하는 방식의 자료구조.
